resources.string: Calibration is past its reagent expiry date
Please order a fresh batch of reagent and recalibrate
Place device face down on a flat surface
Do not move the phone during the test
Colour does not match any calibrated colours.
Check that the chamber has been placed correctly.
Note: Retesting with increased dilution is advised due to high level of contamination
The camera does not meet the minimum requirements.\n\nFor best results, at least 8 megapixel camera required.
This feature is not supported by this device
Can\'t use camera. Make sure flashlight is off and close any apps that may be using the camera
A back facing camera is required for colorimetric analysis
If the problem continues, restart this device
A camera flash was not found on this device
Do you want to calibrate now?
Screen pinned. Press \'Home\' button for more information.
Send details to support for assistance
Send information to our support team to help provide you with assistance in using the app.
Please select your email app in the next step and send the generated email.
Rinse the empty test chamber twice with the sample to remove any traces of previous solutions.
Fill the test chamber to the brim with the sample.
Remove the black plug from the reagent capsule, insert the capsule into the inner chamber as shown.
Screw the lid onto the test chamber until it is tightly shut.
Wipe the transparent bottom of the test chamber (lens diffuser) dry with tissue.
Wipe the phone camera lens dry with tissue.
Match the grooves on the smartphone to the test chamber and twist to lock in position.
If this is your first test, press \'No Dilution\'.
Place the phone face down on a level surface and leave it undisturbed for about a minute. You should get a result after a few beep sounds.
Rinse the mixing chamber with deionised water.
Empty the test chamber and fill it with the deionised water.
Invert the lid and fit it over the inner chamber, aligning the bump on the cap and the inner chamber of the test chamber.
Some excess water will spill into the overflow space. Hold tightly as shown and throw out the excess water.

Next remove the cap and pour the deionised water into the mixing chamber. For two times dilution add one measure of deionised water and one measure of your sample. For five times dilution add four measures of deionised water and one measure of your sample.
Shake the mixing chamber so the deionised water and sample mix thoroughly. Pour the mixture into the Test Chamber. Use this mixture for your measurement.
Rinse the empty cuvette and measuring tube twice with the sample to remove any traces of previous solutions.
Measure 10 ml of the sample with the measuring tube.
Open the vial of Reagent A.
Add Reagent A to the measuring tube.
Close the lid of the measuring tube and shake it to ensure proper mixing of the reagent and sample.
Pour the contents of the mixing tube into the provided cuvette.
Close the lid, wipe any excess water and fit the cuvette into the pipe.
Press the start button below and then place the phone face down, and use the sticker to help center the cuvette over the camera.
Accept the screen pin alert. Then place the phone face down, and use the sticker to help center the cuvette over the camera.
Empty the contents of the cuvette and rinse it once.
Rinse the measuring tube and the test cuvette twice with distilled water to remove any traces of previous solutions.
Add %distilledQty ml of distilled water to the sample to bring the total volume up to 10 ml
This software incorporates material from the projects listed below
